Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.18008336]Virus:HIV:inhibition the cytopathic effects of HIV-1 infection in cultured human T-lymphoblast (CEM-SS) cells(EC50=870 nM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Structure Description: Vhl-1 adopts a compact and well defined structure including a distorted triple-stranded beta-sheet, a short 3(10) helical segment and several turns. It is stabilized by three disulfide bonds, which, together with backbone segments, form a cyclic cystine knot motif. The three-disulfide bonds are almost completely buried into the protein core, and the six cysteines contribute only 3.8% to the molecular surface.
Sequence Information.Function: Probably participates in a plant defense mechanism. Has anti-human immunodeficiency virus activity.
Sequence Information.PTM: Vhl-1 is a cyclic peptide which contains three disulfide bonds 4-21; 8-23; 14-28.

Literature.Title: Cyclotides as natural anti-HIV agents.
Literature.Author: Ireland DC, Wang CK, Wilson JA, Gustafson KR, Craik DJ.
